contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Edsbyn |image_skyline = Edsbyns station 00173.JPG |image_caption = Edsbyn railway station |pushpin_map = Sweden |pushpin_label_position = |coordinates_region = SE |subdivision_type = [[Country]] |subdivision_name = [[Sweden]] |subdivision_type3 = [[Municipalities of Sweden|Municipality]] |subdivision_name3 = [[Ovanåker Municipality]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Counties of Sweden|County]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Gävleborg County]] |subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of Sweden|Province]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Hälsingland]] |area_footnotes = <ref name=scb>{{cite web |url=http://www.scb.se/Statistik/MI/MI0810/2010A01/Tatorternami0810tab1_4.xls |title=Tätorternas landareal, folkmängd och invånare per km<sup>2</sup> 2005 och 2010 |date=14 December 2011 |publisher=[[Statistics Sweden]] |language=Swedish |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/64arqC15e |archivedate=10 January 2012 |deadurl=no |accessdate=10 January 2012}}</ref> |area_total_km2 = 4.53 |population_as_of = 31 December 2010 |population_footnotes = <ref name=scb /> |population_total = 3,985 <!-- This is the official figure from Statistics Sweden (Statistiska centralbyrån). --> |population_density_km2 = 879 |timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset = +1 |timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST = +2 |coordinates_display = display=inline,title |latd=61 |latm=23 |lats= |latNS=N |longd=15 |longm=49 |longs= |longEW=E |website = }} [[File:MagnusKubenOlsson.jpg|thumb|left|250px|[[Magnus Olsson]]]] '''Edsbyn''' is a [[Urban areas in Sweden|locality]] and the seat of [[Ovanåker Municipality]], [[Gävleborg County]], [[Sweden]] with 3,985 inhabitants in 2010.<ref name=scb /> Edsbyn is most famous for their [[ski]] manufacturing industry [[Edsbyverken]], and the sports club [[Edsbyns IF]]. ==Climate== Edsbyn has a sub-arctic climate with long cold winters and short mild summers. Average high temperature in January is -10 °C and average low in January is -19 °C. Although it can vary from season to season, usually in March they have a "snowmobile season"; they use snowmobiles to venture off into the forest, race, fish or just for recreational use/fun. ==Sports== The following sports clubs are located in Edsbyn: * [[Edsbyns IF]] - bandy * [[Edsbyns IF FF]] - football Edsbyns IF is renowned for its successes in men's [[bandy]]. The first indoor bandy arena in Sweden, Dina Arena, was built in Edsbyn and dedicated in 2003 by King Carl XVI Gustaf. <ref>[http://www.dinaarena.se/document/view2.asp?sectionID=184] Information about Edsbyn Arena AB. Retrieved on 2011-07-25.</ref> == References == {{commons}} {{Reflist}} {{Localities in Ovanåker Municipality}} {{Gävleborg County}} [[Category:Populated places in Gävleborg County]] [[Category:Municipal seats of Gävleborg County]] [[Category:Swedish municipal seats]]
